wikipedia_page.main: Philip Plater (6 June 1866 – 12 May 1943) was a British sports shooter. He competed at the 1908 Summer Olympics and the 1912 Summer Olympics.

link_mentions.page: Shooting at the 1908 Summer Olympics – Men's stationary target small-bore rifle
response: Twelve competitors from each nation were allowed to take part.  Because of a delay in the arrival of Barnes' registration, the British team registered Philip Plater as a replacement.  The original registration later arrived, resulting in Britain having 13 entrants.  Further confusion on the day of competition resulted in all 13 shooting, Plater going last.  Plater, who had scored 391 points to place first in the event and set a world record, was ruled to have been the illegal competitor and his score was invalidated.
